turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I was just wastin' time, peanut, till you come back.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: It's me who's wastin' time, Sailor, bein' with you.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Honey, I'm sorry. It wasn't nothin'. Come on and get up and we'll take off.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Leave me be for a minute? Mama gets all insane and then I see you practicin' your individuality and personal freedom with some oil-town tramp. How you figure I'm gonna feel?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Told you not to call your mama.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: How much we got left, honey?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Under a hundred.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You want to stick around here, Sailor? See if we can get some work?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Not in Houston. We'd be better off in some place more out of the way.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You want me to drive for a stretch? Give you a chance to rest.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: That'd be good, Lula.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What's that, peanut?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I can't take no more of this radio...  I ain't never heard so much concentrated weirdness in my life, Sailor Ripley, you find me some dancin' music right this minute... I MEAN IT!!

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: The world's gettin' worse, I think, Sailor. And it don't sound like there's much we can do about it, neither.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: This ain't news, sweetheart. I hate to tell ya.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sure is a big deal round here... Alamo Road, Alamo Street, Alamo Square, Alamo Buildin', Alamo Alamo. They ain't forgettin' about it in a hurry. That's the thing 'bout memory? Some things you wish you could forget... What's troublin' you, sugar?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You know, Lula, I never told you what all I was doin' before I met you.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I just figured you was out bein' Mr. Cool...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Not exactly, sugar... One reason we're in all the trouble we're in right now is cause of what I was doin'... I tried to tell you this before...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You're scarin' me, baby.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Well, there's a good side as well as a bad side to it... The good side is I knew your daddy, and I thought Clyde was a good ol' guy...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You knew my daddy?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Yes I did... I sure did... The bad side of it is I did some drivin' for a man named Marcello Santos...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Oh shit...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I quit workin' for 'im, but just before I did, I ended up one night at a house... I don't know what it is they all think I saw that night, but I was just sittin' out in the car till the whole place went up in flames.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: God, Sailor... That's the night my daddy died.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I know, sugar... But while the place was burnin'... Before Santos came out - I pitched some rocks at the second floor windows case anyone was upstairs sleepin'... Afterwards... When I met you, I always liked to think I mighta saved your life.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: That's some big secret you been carryin', Sailor.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: We all got a secret side, baby. Hope you don't think I been lyin' to you 'bout other things, sugar.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: How'd you know my daddy?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Met him through Santos... Clyde - your daddy - had some sorta business deal with Santos.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Lula, you there?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Yeah, I'm here.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You upset with me?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No, Sailor darlin'. Just shockin' sometimes when things aren't the way you thought they were... I been carryin' a secret too...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: That night in the fire while my daddy was dyin'... I saw mama up in her room with Santos...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: ...They was laughin' arm in arm like animals.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I didn't want to say it... but I had a feelin' Santos was up to somethin' with your mama...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: My mama...  So Sailor, our histories have been somewhat intertwined.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: They have, sugar.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I take that as a sign that we were destined by fate to be together.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: It's a comfortin' idea.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Well, we're really out in the middle of it now, ain't we?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: There's worse places, honey.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Trust me on it.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I do trust you, Sailor. Like I ain't never trusted nobody before.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: We'll be alright, peanut, long as we've got room to move.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I don't know... Looks like clothes.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Oh God, Sailor.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: One bad car accident...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: SAILOR!!!

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sailor, what are we gonna do?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I don't know, honey, but we gotta help that girl - get her to a town and hope no one catches on I broke parole.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Let's get ahold a' her quick.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You think she's gonna make it?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Don't know, but she's gonna bleed all over our car, I'll tell ya that...  Hey... Hello... Girl... You gotta come with us, honey.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I can't take this, Sailor. She's dyin' right in front of our eyes...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I'm afraid she is, baby.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: She died right in front of me. Why'd she have to go and do that, Sailor?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Let's get outta here, honey.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Well, it ain't exactly Emerald City...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Not quite as bad as the weather though... It must be a hundred and ten and it ain't even noon yet.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Not bad for eleven dollars a day.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No radio or TV...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: And no AC.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Fan works.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Now what?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Let's get a sandwich and find out about some work.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sailor?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: This ain't exactly my most thrillin' notion of startin' a new life.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I'm gonna stay here in this room, Sailor. I don't feel so good? This heat makes me tired.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Okay, honey, I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: That you, Sail, honey?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: The only one.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You find any work?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Maybe. Met a guy named Red, owns a garage, could have some work in about a week. Met a few hard luck boys who's stayin' here. What's that smell?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I barfed. Tried to make it to the bathroom... Turned out it was the wrong door anyways... I sorta got it cleaned up.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You sick?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: A little, I think... Darlin'?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Come sit by me.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Darlin', I still ain't feelin' so well. I'm goin' to bed.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I'll come along.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Anything I can do for you?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No, I don't think so, Sail. I just need to lie down.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sailor? You know what?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I know you ain't particularly pleased bein' here.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Not that. Look at what I wrote down cause I can't say it.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: It's okay by me, peanut.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Well, nothin' personal, but I ain't sure it's okay by me.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Really, Sailor, it ain't nothin' against you. I love you.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Love you, too.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I know. Just I'm sorta uncomfortable about the way some things is goin', and this don't help soothe me.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I know this ain't easy, Lula, but I ain't gonna let things get no worse, I promise.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You been drinkin', huh?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Few beers is all. Feelin' any better?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Can't tell yet. Where'd you go?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: That smell's still fillin' this room good.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Buddy and Sparky come by earlier.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: And Bobby too, I hear...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Yeah... He was lookin' for you.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You talk to 'im some?...

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Some... Sparky said Red's promised to have him and Buddy out of here by the weekend.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Oughta make 'em happy.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: So where'd you say you was?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Went with Bobby.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sail?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Let's leave here.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: We're goin' to, Lula, real soon.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I mean tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: We got about forty bucks, sweetheart. That'd get us to El Paso.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Rather be in El Paso than Big Tuna.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Who says I'm smart? You up to somethin' with Bobby Peru, Sailor?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What could I be up to, Lula?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: He's a stone fuckin' criminal, honey, and you ain't.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I killed Bob Ray Lemon, didn't I?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: That was a accident. I bet both our asses Bobby Peru done murdered all kinds of people, and meant it, too.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: That was in Vietnam.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: He's the kind liked it.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Lula, I got to get some sleep.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Buddy told me about that thing at Cao Ben?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Was a massacre. Soldiers there murdered old folks, women and babies, and dumped 'em in a trench. Bobby Peru prob'ly killed the most.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Lula, he mighta did, I don't know. But it don't matter now. Lotta guys go outta control in a war and it ain't their fault.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: That man's a black angel, Sailor. You hook up with him, you'll regret it. If you live to.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Thanks, darlin', I know you got my best interest in mind, and I 'preciate it sincerely. I love you, but I gotta sleep now.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You must be my son.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Shake hands with your daddy.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: You hungry? Pace and I ain't had dinner yet.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Lead the way.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Sailor. I just can't help it. Give me a minute and I'll quit.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Boys frightened, Lula. This ain't no good.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Really, Sail, I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: It's a mistake, honey. You two go on. I'll walk back to the depot.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: What're you talkin' about? That's your son in there.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: He ain't never known me, Lula, so there ain't much for him to forget. Not seein' each other for six years makes it next best to simple for us, too.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: How can you say that, Sailor?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What makes sense, is all.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: LULA!!!!

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: SAILOR!!!!

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: ...live in exchange for sexual favors. Police said they have identified and questioned at least four girls, all Asians twelve to fifteen years old, who have been living in the North Houston warehouse with a Vietnamese pimp since February. The girls are being treated as victims, said police Sergeant Amos Milburn. 'These are really just children,' he said, 'but they've been exposed to a lot already.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: In international news, India plans to release crocodiles in the Ganges, the holy Hindu river in which millions of people bathe annually, to scavenge for corpses, authorities said.

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: The reptiles were supposed to be of a docile species, said a senior government official, but it seems the breeders bungled and reared attack crocodiles.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Damn!

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: The Indian official who supplied this information did so only on condition of anonymity. The Uttar Pradesh state authorities last October released five hundred turtles...

turns.speaker: REPORTER
turns.text: In the Ganges near Varanasi to try and reduce human pollution and now plan to put in the crocodiles to devour floatin' corpses dumped by Hindus too poor to pay for cremation.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: HOLY SHIT!! IT'S THE NIGHT OF THE LIVIN' FUCKIN' DEAD!!!!

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Mama???

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: You know who it was and you know you aren't, and I mean ARE NOT gonna see him EVER... End of story.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Like hell.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I'm fine, mama. I just wanted to tell you not to worry.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Why, how could I not worry? Not knowin' what's happenin' to you or where you are? Are you with that boy?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: If you mean Sailor, mama, yes I am.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Are you comin' back here soon, Lula? I need you here.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Need me for what, mama? I'm perfectly fine, and safe, too.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: You in a dance hall or somethin'? I can hear music behind you.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Just a place.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Really, Lula, this ain't right!

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Right?! Mama, was it right for you to sic Johnnie Farragut on us? How could you do that?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Did you run into Johnnie in New Orleans? Lula, are you in New Orleans?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: No, mama, I'm in Mexico, and we're about to get on an airplane to Argentina!

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Argentina! Lula, you're outta your mind. Now you just tell me where you are and I'll come for you. I won't say nothin' to the police about Sailor, I promise. He can do what he wants, I don't care.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Mama, I'm hangin' up this phone now.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No, baby, don't! Can I send you somethin'? You runnin' low on money? I'll wire you some money if you tell me where you are.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I ain't that dumb, mama. Sailor and I been on a crime spree? Knockin' off convenience stores all across the south? Ain't you read about it?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Lula? I love you, baby. I just want you to be all right.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I am all right, mama. That's why I called, to let you know. I gotta go.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Call me again soon? I'll be waitin' by the phone.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Don't be crazy, mama. Take care of yourself.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: You're comin' home, precious. Santos' gonna drive us to the San Antonio airport.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Mama, Sailor's in deep trouble here. I just can't leave him.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: I'm goin', mama. No way I can't go.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: You ain't takin' Pace, though.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Course I am, mama.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: What time's Sailor's train get in?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Six.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Got any plans?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Figure we'll go have supper someplace. Maybe get some barbecue out by Stateline. Sailor always liked that Havana Brown's Pig Pickin'.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Well, you be careful with that boy, Lula.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Sailor ain't a boy no more, mama.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Don't mean him. It's Pace concerns me.

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Really, mama, I gotta go.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: What if I asked you not to?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Wouldn't make any difference.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: What if I told you not to?

turns.speaker: LULA
turns.text: Mama... if you get in the way of me and Sailor's happiness, I'll fuckin' pull your arms out by the roots.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I'm afraid his car is gone, Mrs. Fortune.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: I don't understand this... I don't understand this one bit. He was supposed to meet me right her in this lobby. Somethin' bad has happened - I jus know it.

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Perhaps we should call a local law enforcement officer.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: HELL NO!!! That's the last thing we need... A buncha cops runnin' around.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Oh God! What does that mean?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: I'm sure I wouldn't know, ma'am... and buffalo hunting too... hmmmmm?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: And jus when my baby's out on some Texas road with a killer.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: I knew you'd want it again...

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: That's not why I called.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Oh yeah - sure... okay.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... It isn't.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Have it your way... But you want it.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Lula's gone off with Sailor.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: What do you want me to do about it?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: I want you to take care of Sailor, so he won't ever be able to bother my baby again.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Take care of him?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: What does take care of him mean? Do you want me to give him food or some clothing?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: What's with you? You know what take care of him means. I don't call Santos except for one big reason.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Big is the key word, and I'm telling you I want it bad.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: I want you to get rid of Sailor.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Get rid of him?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes... Get rid of him.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: How would I do that? Send him on a trip - like maybe to Hawaii?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos, why in hell do you insist on playin' this stupid game?

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Just tell me what you want.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: I don't need to explain anymore'n I have... You know damn well.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: You need to explain it.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: All right... I want you... to... kill... Sailor... As simple as that.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Simple? Kill him? How?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: That's your business... I don't care how.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Like an accident where maybe Lula might also get hurt?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: NO... For God's sakes, Santos!

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Well, like kill him with the atomic bomb?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Explain it... I told you.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Shoot him.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Shoot him? Like with a gun?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Where? In the leg?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: In the head.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Shoot Sailor in the head with a gun... Now I'm beginning to get it... You want me to shoot Sailor in the head with a gun.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: But where in the head? Not the chin, I hope.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No... In the brains... What little I'm sure he has.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: You want me to shoot Sailor in the brains with a gun.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Through the forehead?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Wrong! It's much better to blow a hole in the back of the head... right toward the bridge of the nose... Lots and lots of irreparable damage.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: See! I knew you had it all under control.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Why didn't you send Johnnie Farragut?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Maybe I did... Try New Orleans first... Lula can't ever stop talkin' 'bout that town.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: On one condition...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: You give me your permission to kill Johnnie Farragut.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... No... Please, Santos...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: You're not tellin' me that you're sweet on him?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No... But...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: One day he's gonna find out what we're up to with Mr. Reindeer, and he could cause us a lot of trouble.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: I'm gonna take your silence as a "yes"...

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... I can't...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Shhhh... It's all right... Also, I either take you or that pretty daughter of yours to bed.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: You fucker, don't you ever touch Lula - You fucker, I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Put your shoulders back.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Put your shoulders back, I said.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: You got nice tits.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Someone's gonna see us.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: That's just another part of the price to pay.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... You kill that Sailor, otherwise he's gonna turn my baby against me.

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: I got your message... But you went right to Johnnie, didn't you?... I can't trust you, bitch - not for one minute... Naughty girl... Sailor and Lula are headed west, and guess what? There's no turning back. I'm in a killing mood.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: My very best to Johnnie... Bless his soul.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... Where's J-J-Johnnie?

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Shhhhhh...  Thank you, gentlemen... I'll look after her now...

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Santos... What's happenin' here?

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Hey... Stop the nervous cry-baby routine... You're my girl now... Santos is gonna wipe away those tears and make you happy... Come on, let's get outta here.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Where we goin'?

turns.speaker: SANTOS
turns.text: Got word the kids are moving through Texas... I think an ending is being arranged there... Come on, lemme see a smile.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Please Santos... Where's Johnnie?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: ...Sailor Ripley... Can I talk to Lula?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: There's no way in hell you can speak to her and...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: What?...

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: ...Yes you heard me... Don't ever call back here again.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Hey, Sailor boy, you wanna fuck Lula's mama?...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Well, she wants to fuck you.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: No... I just wanted to kiss you good- bye... You know too much 'bout little Lula's mom...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Whattya mean?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Well, Johnnie told me you used to drive for Clyde and Santos...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: So maybe one night you got a little too close to the fire... And you're gonna get burned, baby... And besides that, you're shit... D'you think I'd let my little girl go with shit like you?... Why, you belong right here in one of these toilets.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You're gonna have to kill me to keep me away from Lula.

turns.speaker: MARIETTA
turns.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout that...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: It's a prob'lm I don't think's gonna go away too soon though... Peanut, I'm thinkin' of breakin' parole and takin' you out to sunny California.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Oh... Look at this... What do you want, snakeskin?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Just passin' through on my way to who knows where...

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Sure... I figured I'd see you sometime...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Hopin' you could tell me if there's a contract out on me. I really need to know.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: By who?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I think Santos or Marietta Fortune.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Heard you was goin' out with that bitch's daughter.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: You heard right.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: You really are one dumb asshole.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Life is unpredictable.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Does that girlfriend of yours know that her mama and Santos killed her daddy?  Does she know her own daddy was one of the biggest drug dealers around - till he started snortin' the shit himself?...  Does she know you was around that night her daddy was set fire to?

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: I didn't see nothin'...

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: Yeah... But I did... And I told you all about it...

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Is there a contract?... We made a deal once that we'd tip each other off if we ever heard.

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: I know... I remember.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Well?...

turns.speaker: PERDITA
turns.text: I ain't heard of nothin'.

turns.speaker: SAILOR
turns.text: Thanks...

turns.speaker: VERNON
turns.text: I'll tell you the problem. You behind the wheel. There's your fucking problem.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: That's pretty simplistic, don't you think?

turns.speaker: VERNON
turns.text: Hey, pal, you don't start doing crazy eights in the middle of the street none of this happens.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Excuse me. Did you, or did you not, have a gun to his head?

turns.speaker: VERNON
turns.text: He was trying to steal my car!

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: What he means is, it's difficult to distill the essence of a book sometimes. It lives in the mind.

turns.speaker: VERNON
turns.text: Yeah, but you gotta know what it's about, right? I mean, if you didn't know what it was about, why were you writing it?

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: That's just how my brain works, I guess.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Fascinating. Listen, why don't you come out with us after the lecture. There's a place on the Hill I always get Trip to take me.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: Actually... I just want to go home.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Oh, don't be silly. No one your age just wants to go home. Besides, faculty will be present. Just think of it as a field trip.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He's fine. He's narrating.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: We're going to the men's room. Only we might not make it in time.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: Hey. What are you guys doing here?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: We're springing you, Leer. Get some pants on.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I like what you've done with it. When's Captain Nemo moving in?

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: The candelabras were my Gran's.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: You all right, Professor Tripp?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He's great. Come on, let's blow before lo' Gran decides to boil your bones for breakfast.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: Oh, well, that's just it. She's been coming down here, every half hour or so, to, sort of, check on me. If I'm not here, she might... call the police or... something.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Hhhuh. So we decoy her. Stick a couple pillows and one of your teddy bears under the spread and she won't know the difference.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: Yeah. Like in Against All Flags. Only they use a couple big hams.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: You snore.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So I hear.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: No offense, Professor Tripp, but you look sorta crappy.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He's right, you look horrible.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: It's the Chancellor.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Ah, right. Well, I gave you my opinion.

turns.speaker: JAMES LEER
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: You're welcome.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Tripp!

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: How are you, Crabtree?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Brimming. Say hello to my new friend, Miss Antonia... uh...

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I was explaining to Antonia how a book comes to be published. What you do as a writer, what I do as an editor...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I sweat blood for five years and he checks for spelling.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Emily?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Your wife.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Oh. We're picking her up. Downtown.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Perfect. Well then, shall we?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Do you know how many times I've boarded an airplane praying someone like her would sit down beside me? Particularly while I'm on my way to Pittsburgh.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Lay off Pittsburgh. It's one of the great cities.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: If it can produce a Miss Sloviak you'll get no argument from me.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: She's a transvestite.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: You're stoned.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: She's still a transvestite.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Isn't she?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: It's fine. It's done. Basically. I'm just sort of... tinkering with it.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Great. I was hoping I could get a look at it sometime this weekend. Think that might be possible?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I don't know. I'm sort of at a critical... juncture.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I thought you were tinkering.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I just mean...

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Forget I asked. I don't want to pressure you, Tripp. But...  ...I get pressure. Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: You didn't actually purchase this car, did you. Trip??

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: It was Jerry Nathan's. He owed me money.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He owes God money. You know, he queered himself for good with Esquire.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He said something about being between things.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Yeah, between a bookie and a pair of broken legs.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Trip??

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: She left me. Crabs.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Left you...? Who? Emily?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: This morning. I found a note in the kitchen.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: But. ...why didn't you say something, Tripp? I mean, what are we doing here?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I thought you were Mrs. Gaskell's hobby, Tripp.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Piss off, Crabs. I lost a wife today.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Oh, I'm sure you'll find another. You always do.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Is that just beer?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Primarily. Although I gather you two staged a little raid on the Crabtree pharmacopoeia. You missed a few bottles, by the way.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I'm sure. Where is everyone?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Sara and Walter declined. Guess they wanted to go home and curl up on the couch with the dog.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He has a book.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I know. He started it Fall semester.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He finished it Winter Break.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So. Is he any good?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: No. Not yet he isn't.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Well, I'm going to read it anyway.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Come on. Crabs. Don't do this. He's one of my students, for Christ sake. I'm not even sure if he's --

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He is. Take my word for it.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I think it's more complicated than that. Besides, he's a little... scattered. He almost... did something stupid tonight. At least, I think so. Anyway, he doesn't need sexual confusion thrown into the stew right now.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: On the contrary, it could be just the ticket.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: No sexual confusion there, eh, Professor?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Shut up and drink.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He's a boxer. A flyweight.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Huh uh. A jockey. His name's, um, Curtis... Curtis Hardapple.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Not Curtis.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Vernon, then. Vernon Hardapple. The scar's are from a -- from a horse. He fell during a race and got trampled.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: And now he's addicted to painkillers.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: He can't piss standing up anymore.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He lives with his mother.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: And he had a younger brother who... was... a...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Groom. Named Claudell. And his mother blames Vernon for his death.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Because... because...

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: That was good.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He heard everything we were saying.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Christ, Crabs, what do you expect me to do? The kid's practically in a coma.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Tripp.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Hit your brakes.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: What's this guy's problem?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Just go around him.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Back up. Go out the other way.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Wait here. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Where would we go?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Tripp?!

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Listen, Hannah, I'm flattered, really, but right now I --

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Tripp, where the hell...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: You stay there.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: What? Ohhhh. Is that... it?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Honestly, Tripp. Do you actually think I would sneak in here and read your book without asking you?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Gee, I don't know, Crabs. I don't seem to remember you actually asking me if you could invite 200 people over to trash my living room.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Sometimes we have to improvise.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Think, Hannah. Does James have any friends. I mean, besides you and... me?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: James? My James? What's happened?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Nothing, he's just been sort of, I don't know... kidnapped.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Kidnapped? By who?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: His parents.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Good God. Let's go rescue him.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Good idea, Crabs. Only one problem. I don't know where they live.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Ah. Wait a minute. The university must know where he lives.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: It's a little late to call Admissions.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Is it a little late to call the Chancellor?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Maybe... I don't know.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: You know -- based on what I've read -- this is a very exciting piece of material, this Big Parade.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Love. It's Love Parade -- and what do you mean 'based on what you've read'? You skimmed two chapters at 80 miles an hour while gargling methamphetamines.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I've been doing this a long time, Tripp. I feel this kid in my bones.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Only in your bones?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: How bad is it for you?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Bad enough. And God knows I don't exactly fit the new corporate profile.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Which is?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Competence.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So tell me about you and the Chancellor.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: What's to tell?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Plenty, I'm sure. But, for what it's worth...

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Jesus. There must be two dozen windows on that thing. How are we supposed to find his?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: I told you. They keep him chained in the basement. Come on.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Oh, Christ, don't start on ol' Gran or we'll leave you here.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Hey, I heard all about it -- the parents, the grandparents, the China town thing -- and I believe you, okay? That's why we're here. Now go get dressed.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So modest.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: So sensitive.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Oh, come on, Tripp. Cut the kid some slack.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: It's just ail that crap he spins out. Just once I'd like to know if the little bastard is telling the truth.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: The truth. I know that's always been real important to you. Okay, check this out...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Crabtree.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Ye-es?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Is he awake?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I'm afraid he's pretty worn out, poor kid.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Nevertheless. There's a police officer standing on the porch and I don't think he's going away.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Shut up, James.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: There is no problem. Did I say there was a problem?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Who do you think it is?

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: The Chancellor's here? Now?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Evidently.  Coming!

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: I want to publish this. I've got to. I think they'll let me. With a little editorial guidance it could be brilliant.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Great. Between you and Officer Pupcik out there he can be the next Jean Genet. It's been awhile since somebody wrote a good book in jail.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So -- what do we do now?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Find the jacket.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Oh! Huh. Exactly how do we do that?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: First I see if Hannah will let me borrow her car.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: It seems to me that girl would let you borrow her pancreas.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Want some help with that?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Don't touch it.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Let me get this straight. Jerry Nathan owes you money. So, as collateral, he gives you his car.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: Only now I'm starting to think the car wasn't exactly Jerry's to give.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: So whose car is it?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: My guess -- Vernon Hardapple.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: The hood jumper?

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: He said a few things that lead me to believe the car's his.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Such as.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: 'That's my car, motherfucker.'

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: Uh huh. So. We find Vernon, we find the car. We find the car...

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: ...we find the jacket.

turns.speaker: CRABTREE
turns.text: There's only one problem, Tripp. We don't know his real name. We just made it up. In fact, we made the whole guy up.

turns.speaker: GRADY
turns.text: No wonder he screwed us over.
